pr_title: [BEAM-10114] Add partition increase handling to PubsubLiteIO

timeline.message: feat: Add partition increase handling to PubsubLiteIO
fix: Ensure manually set partitions are not ignored.

timeline.bodyText: You may want to update the javadoc of public abstract Set<Partition> partitions();. Based on your code, whether the partitions is empty will lead to different behavior.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: "A set of partitions. If empty, retrieve the set of partitions using an admin client." is the comment there. I think that is still an accurate explanation?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: You may want to highlight the ability of watching partitions growth when partitions() is empty. This is the key information when users look into javadoc.
replies.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Even though the terminate will not be true in this PR, I'm wondering how is pollDuration.multipliedBy(10) computed?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: This is for unit testing purposes only. If set to true, it polls 10 times. I'm open to better testing methodologies if they exist.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: pollDuration and terminate should be configurable from PubSubLiteIO with provided default values. What do you think?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: And for terminate, if you decide to use Watch.Growth.afterTotalOf as the termination condition, it would be better to have the time duration directly instead of a boolean. What do you think?
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText:
should be configurable from PubSubLiteIO

I don't know why? I can't imagine a user would care how often they were polling for an event that is likely to be human triggered. I'd rather defer this until someone asks for it.

if you decide to use Watch.Growth.afterTotalOf as the termination condition, it would be better to have the time duration directly instead of a boolean

It will never terminate. The boolean only exists for testing purposes, as testing unbounded transforms seems to be an unsolved problem as of yet? If you can think of a better way to test this let me know.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText:
I don't know why? I can't imagine a user would care how often they were polling for an event that is likely to be human triggered. I'd rather defer this until someone asks for it.

If users have a good knowledge on the pattern on partitions growth, they can figure out a reasonable poll duration to be able to detect the new produced partitions as soon as possible, or to avoid doing polling so frequently.

It will never terminate. The boolean only exists for testing purposes, as testing unbounded transforms seems to be an unsolved problem as of yet? If you can think of a better way to test this let me know.

Hmmm that's a real problem for testing unbounded transform. I don't have a better idea now.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText:
the pattern on partitions growth

This should be O(months) apart. I think the default frequency is fine.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Is it intended to always have the watermark as Instant.EPOCH? It will hold back the system watermark unnecessary and the worst case is that downstream operations will have to wait for this watch transform to complete to process.
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText:
Is it intended to always have the watermark as Instant.EPOCH

I don't care what the watermark is, so I used EPOCH as the default value. Should I use something like Instant.now()?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Instant.now() is better than Instant.EPOCH. You should care about the watermark here since the watermark here will affect the watermark of the whole pipeline.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: It shouldn't, since the next stage will overwrite the timestamps and watermarking IIUC. But I'll change to Instant.now().
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText:
It shouldn't, since the next stage will overwrite the timestamps and watermarking IIUC.

At least Dataflow will compute a global watermark, which is the minimal watermark of all stages. That's why you don't want to hold the watermark here.
replies.author: boyuanzz
